meanings.definition: The diameter of a bullet or other projectile.
meanings.sent1: The calibre of the bullet was small.
meanings.sent2: The gun was designed for bullets of a specific calibre.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally bought bullets of the wrong calibre for my gun.
meanings.sent4: Her aim was of such calibre that she never missed a target.
meanings.sent5: The calibre of the bullet determined its impact on the target.

meanings.definition: The quality or standard of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The calibre of his work was exceptional.
meanings.sent2: The school only accepts students of high calibre.
meanings.sent3: His jokes were of such low calibre that no one laughed.
meanings.sent4: The calibre of her leadership was unmatched in the company.
meanings.sent5: The calibre of the product determined its success in the market.

meanings.definition: The ability or capacity of someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: Her calibre as a singer was evident in every performance.
meanings.sent2: The team captain's calibre motivated the players to do their best.
meanings.sent3: His calibre in cooking was so poor that he burned every dish.
meanings.sent4: The calibre of his problem-solving skills impressed everyone.
meanings.sent5: The calibre of her creativity shone through in her artwork.
